1134001.post_content:
Congratulations! You have successfully completed Working with Presets and Custom CSS!

Now that you’ve learned how to work with presets and custom CSS, let's move things in a different direction.

You can now proceed to the next unit, Creating Beautiful Sites with Builder.

1.title: Unit Introduction
1.description:
With the Upfront Builder, you can create your very own WordPress themes from scratch without touching a single line of code.

You know that website you've always wanted to build but haven't? Or that theme you've been searching everywhere for, like, ever? Well, now you can build that theme with Builder.

Drag and drop, scale, position, customize and see every edit you make to your website as you make it in real-time with Upfront and Builder.

With the Upfront Builder plugin, you can create beautiful responsive layouts and even save and export them to use on other WordPress websites for lightning fast development. No more migration headaches!

From proof-of-concept design and fully functioning client mockups to polished deliverable themes, Upfront Builder is the only platform you need.

[pic_full_screen ]

[caption id="" align="aligncenter" width="1364"] The Upfront Builder interface isn't all that different from the Upfront starter theme interface – though you do get to start building your themes with a blank slate.[/caption]

[/pic_full_screen]

2.title: Tasks

1134003.post_content:
Getting Started with Builder

Once you have Builder installed, go to Upfront > Builder in the admin dashboard. [pic_full ] [caption id="" align="aligncenter" width="670"] When you install the Builder plugin, a new option will appear in the Upfront admin menu.[/caption] [/pic_full] In the Build New Theme field, give your theme a name. It can be anything you like. [pic_full_screen ] [caption id="" align="aligncenter" width="1364"] Name your theme whatever you like, but keep in mind the name will be used for the directory, too, which you won't be able to change later.[/caption] [/pic_full_screen] When you have entered a name, click Start Building and you will be redirected to the Upfront Builder editor to start building your theme. If you’re using Builder for the first time, a getting started wizard will launch and run you through how to use the plugin.

Finding Your Way Around Builder

The Builder interface is almost identical to the Upfront editor for starter themes that you’ve become familiar with in this course, with a few key differences. Let’s look at the similarities first. You’ll notice in the sidebar that the tabbed sections for Draggable Elements and Theme Settings are available and there are icons for Responsive move and grid mode, as well as icons at the top for leaving the editor. But that’s where the similarities end with the sidebar. You’ll see that the New Page and New Post buttons are missing and the Save button has been replaced with a Save Theme button. There are also a few new buttons you need to become familiar with:

Layouts

Add or edit new pages to your site for specific uses, such as a single post or page (archive, 404, category, contact, etc). This button replaces the Posts / Pages button in the Upfront starter theme editor. [pic_full ] [caption id="" align="aligncenter" width="670"] You can edit an existing page layout or create a new one.[/caption] [/pic_full]

Media

This links to the images and other media files in your media library that won’t be exported with your theme. They’re only stored on your site. ￼[pic_full ] [caption id="" align="aligncenter" width="670"] Access your media – upload and edit images.[/caption] [/pic_full]

UI / Sprites

These are the images you want to include in your theme that will be packaged with it when you export your theme. While there are a few minor interface differences, you should be familiar enough with Upfront now to dive in and start adding regions and elements to your site.

Exporting, Importing and Editing Your Theme

Once you’ve built and completed a new theme in Builder, you might want to share it with other Upfront users or simply export it to use on another WordPress site. For example, if you develop websites using a localhost install of WordPress, you can export your theme files and import them to a live site. Here’s how to use Builder to export a theme:
  1. In the Builder editor, save your changes by clicking Save Theme.
  2. Click Themes and you’ll be redirected to the Upfront Builder screen.
  3. Hover over the theme you want to export and click the download icon. Your theme will download as a ZIP file.
Note: when you hover over listed themes, you can also choose to Edit Theme Info, which allows you to edit the name, image, description, version number and other details for a theme, and export your theme with images, or Edit in Builder, which will take you back to the Builder editor to edit your theme. And here’s how you import a theme:
  1. Ensure you have Upfront already installed on the website that you want to import your theme to.
  2. Go to Appearance > Themes and click Add New. Select your theme and upload it as you would any other WordPress theme.
  3. Activate your theme and you’re good to go.
[pic_full_screen ] [caption id="" align="aligncenter" width="1364"] Just some of the layouts out in-house designers have created using Upfront – and you can try laying out yourself with Builder.[/caption] [/pic_full_screen]

Start Creating Your Very Own Stunning WordPress Website

We’ve covered a lot of ground in this course! You’ve learned your way around Upfront, how to edit themes, customize them with elements and regions, make advanced changes with custom code and even build your own themes from scratch with Builder. In this tutorial you learned:
  • How to download, install and activate Builder
  • The differences between editing Upfront starter themes and using Builder
  • How to get started using Builder
  • How to export and important themes
I hope you’ve enjoyed this course and it has opened your eyes to the possibilities of Upfront! Good luck creating and editing your own Upfront themes!

1134005.post_content:
You've spent the past five units getting to know Upfront and how to build your own beautiful websites with its intuitive drag-and-drop interface. Each week there's been homework and this final unit is no different! This lesson's homework is to create a one-pager portfolio website that shows off you. Include the following on your site:
  • A logo or Text element using your name
  • Examples of your work – you might want to use a gallery to display images or your work
  • An "About Me" region with a bio and photo of you
  • A "Contact Me" region with your details, including a contact form and map
  • Social media icons

1134006.post_content:
During this final unit of the course, you learned:
  • How to download, install and activate Builder
  • The differences between editing Upfront starter themes and using Builder
  • How to get started using Builder
  • How to export and important themes
How did you get playing around with the Upfront Builder? Share your experiences below. And share some of your designs! If you have published any of your Upfront websites online, share your links below. This discussion is your opportunity to ask any questions and chat with other students and course facilitators.

3.title: Assessment
3.description:
At the end of each unit, you are required to complete a multiple choice quiz based on the concepts you learned about in the tutorial and video. You need to achieve an 80% score in order to pass and move on to the next unit in the course.

If you find the quiz tough, it's because we've made it deliberately challenging – we want you to think about what you've learned (and really earn the certificate at the end of the course!). Each of the questions is based on what's been covered in the course material so if you've paid attention you should have no problems.

Good luck!

1134007.post_content:
Take your time, read through the questions and, if you need to, go back to the tutorial and video and review what you’ve learned before answering the quiz questions.

Good luck!
